revised_title: The Significance of Cook's Voyages in the History of Navigation and Science
tldr: The article discusses the opening of the Cook Gallery at the National Maritime Museum, highlighting the importance of Captain James Cook's voyages in the history of navigation and science. Cook's first voyage, which began in 1768, marked a turning point in navigation techniques, as he determined longitude using lunar distance. The article also mentions the Royal Society's role in organizing the expedition and Cook's election as a Fellow and recipient of the Copley Medal.
